body:
For all those affected, temporary workaround on Linux until it is fixed properly can be one of following:

1. enable unconditional overcommit: `sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=1`
1. add swap to your host, with `sysctl -w vm.swappiness=1` it will almost never going to be used, but it participates in calculations where Linux kernel decides to whether  it can afford to satisfy allocation or not when default `overcommit_memory=0` is in use
